14
15#ifndef DNS_RDATALIST_H
16#define DNS_RDATALIST_H 1
17
18/*****
19 ***** Module Info
20 *****/
21
22/*! \file dns/rdatalist.h
23 * \brief
24 * A DNS rdatalist is a list of rdata of a common type and class.
25 *
26 * MP:
27 *\li Clients of this module must impose any required synchronization.
28 *
29 * Reliability:
30 *\li No anticipated impact.
31 *
32 * Resources:
33 *\li TBS
34 *
35 * Security:
36 *\li No anticipated impact.
37 *
38 * Standards:
39 *\li None.
40 */
41
42#include <isc/lang.h>
43
44#include <dns/types.h>
45
46/*%
47 * Clients may use this type directly.
48 */
49struct dns_rdatalist {
50 dns_rdataclass_t rdclass;
51 dns_rdatatype_t type;
52 dns_rdatatype_t covers;
53 dns_ttl_t ttl;
54 ISC_LIST(dns_rdata_t) rdata;
55 ISC_LINK(dns_rdatalist_t) link;
56 /*%<
57 * Case vector. If the bit is set then the corresponding
58 * character in the owner name needs to be AND'd with 0x20,
59 * rendering that character upper case.
60 */
61 unsigned char upper[32];
62};
63
64ISC_LANG_BEGINDECLS
65
66void
67dns_rdatalist_init(dns_rdatalist_t *rdatalist);
68/*%<
69 * Initialize rdatalist.
70 *
71 * Ensures:
72 *\li All fields of rdatalist have been initialized to their default
73 * values.
74 */
75
76isc_result_t
77dns_rdatalist_tordataset(dns_rdatalist_t *rdatalist,
78 dns_rdataset_t *rdataset);
79/*%<
80 * Make 'rdataset' refer to the rdata in 'rdatalist'.
81 *
82 * Note:
83 *\li The caller must ensure that 'rdatalist' remains valid and unchanged
84 * while 'rdataset' is associated with it.
85 *
86 * Requires:
87 *
88 *\li 'rdatalist' is a valid rdatalist.
89 *
90 *\li 'rdataset' is a valid rdataset that is not currently associated with
91 * any rdata.
92 *
93 * Ensures,
94 * on success,
95 *
96 *\li 'rdataset' is associated with the rdata in rdatalist.
97 *
98 * Returns:
99 *\li #ISC_R_SUCCESS
100 */
101
102isc_result_t
103dns_rdatalist_fromrdataset(dns_rdataset_t *rdataset,
104 dns_rdatalist_t **rdatalist);
105/*%<
106 * Point 'rdatalist' to the rdatalist in 'rdataset'.
107 *
108 * Requires:
109 *
110 *\li 'rdatalist' is a pointer to a NULL dns_rdatalist_t pointer.
111 *
112 *\li 'rdataset' is a valid rdataset associated with an rdatalist.
113 *
114 * Ensures,
115 * on success,
116 *
117 *\li 'rdatalist' is pointed to the rdatalist in rdataset.
118 *
119 * Returns:
120 *\li #ISC_R_SUCCESS
121 */
122
123ISC_LANG_ENDDECLS
124
125#endif /* DNS_RDATALIST_H */
126
